article_title: South Carolinians rank low on economic security, report says
article_text:
South Carolinians rank 45th in financial security among other states, DC

Low-wage jobs, education, health care costs are roadblocks for low-income families

Widening inequality gap disproportionately affects families of color

article_metadata.news-keywords: South Carolina, insecurity. low income, health care, poverty line, inequality, financial security, economic
article_metadata.description: Too many South Carolina families remain economically vulnerable, with low-wage jobs and crippling health care costs disproportionately burdening families of color, a new report says.
article_metadata.title: South Carolinians rank low on economic security, report says | The Star-Telegram
